EXAMPLES

Here are some usage examples of the QENSFit package.

Basic Usage Example

This example demonstrates the simplest way to use QENSFit.

 1# Import the library
 2
 3import numpy as np
 4import qensfit.qensfit as qf
 5
 6
 7# Define a model function to fit the data. Here x is the independent
 8# variable, a, omega and phi are parameters, and q is a dataset-dependent
 9# constant. For more info about the function signature, please refer to
10# the Model.target documentation
11
12def fitmodel(x, /, a, omega, phi, *, q):
13    """Test fit function"""
14    return a * np.sin(omega * x + phi) * np.exp(-x / q)
15
16
17# Declare a list of Parameter objects, with the SAME NAME as those
18# you declared in the model function, so that you can control their initial
19# values, bounds, fix them or make them global
20
21lst = [qf.Parameter('omega', [0.2, 0.6, 1.7], 0., 50.,
22                    ax_name = r'$\omega\ (rad/s)$'),
23       qf.Parameter('phi', 1., 0., 5., is_global = True,
24                    ax_name = r'$\Phi\ (rad)$'),
25       qf.Parameter('a', 10., 5., 25., is_fixed = False),]
26
27
28# Here we're generating some synthetic data as an example
29
30x = np.array([np.linspace(0,20,201) for _ in range(3)])
31y = np.zeros(x.shape)
32y2 = np.zeros(x.shape)
33dy = np.ones(x.shape) * 0.5
34q = np.array([7.*(i+1) for i in range(3)])
35
36for i in range(x.shape[0]):
37    y[i] = (10. * (np.sin((i+1)/2 * x[i] + 1.) * np.exp(-x[i] / q[i])) +
38            (1.5 * np.random.random_sample(y[i].shape) - 1))
39    y2[i] = (15. * (np.sin((i+1)/2 * x[i] + 2.) * np.exp(-x[i] / q[i])) +
40            (2. * np.random.random_sample(y[i].shape) - 1))
41
42
43# Wrap the data in a dictionary containing QENSDataset objects (this
44# will not be necessary if youare using the load_ascii function).
45
46data = {'ds1': qf.QENSDataset(x = x, y = y, dy = dy, q = q),
47        'ds2': qf.QENSDataset(x = x, y = y2, dy = dy, q = q)}
48
49
50# Instantiate a Model object using the declared model function, the list
51# of Parameter, and the input data dictionary. Then run the fit, et voilà!
52
53mod = qf.Model(fitmodel, lst, data)
54mod.run_fit(plot = True, autosave = True)
